hints.content:
This square is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $2$ pieces shaded.  

![A square has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c523fb197a3802dbd83312a7add0904c3c248750)

This square has two thirds of the shape shaded.

This square is **not** split into $3$ equal-sized pieces. 

![A square has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 unequal parts. The smallest part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dc249cddb6ee3c88a9c71a876f75749e5e2c50ff)

This square is split into $4$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{fourths}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A square has 2 diagonal lines from opposite corners dividing it into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded gold.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/498e1e38c719659ee3f34e5fe11fae22598b7860)

This square has one fourth of the shape shaded.

This square is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A square has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e6b1c68bea47dc97468829f78c4792c037d0cc3d)

This square have one third of the shape shaded.

This square has **one third** of the shape shaded:

![A square has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e6b1c68bea47dc97468829f78c4792c037d0cc3d)

question.content:
**Which square shows one third of the shape shaded?**

choices.content: ![A square has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e6b1c68bea47dc97468829f78c4792c037d0cc3d)
![A square has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c523fb197a3802dbd83312a7add0904c3c248750)
![A square has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 unequal parts. The smallest part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dc249cddb6ee3c88a9c71a876f75749e5e2c50ff)

![A square has 2 diagonal lines from opposite corners dividing it into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded gold.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/498e1e38c719659ee3f34e5fe11fae22598b7860)
